channel.title: Projects on Owen Stanclift
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Owen Stanclift

item.title: Chop Off
item.description:
Description

My second game I made with a team. An educational game that can be played on Android devices that teaches kids about the Lumber Jack games while playing a series of minigames related to them.

item.title: Game Architecture Final
item.description:
___

Description

GameArchitectureFinal: A final that turned out way better than expected. A Turn-Based RPG made from Visual Studio and a library alone, no game engine. The game had an animation manager to go through sprite sheets of characters as well as many other gameplay mechanics I programmed in like saving.

item.title: Game-AI-Final
item.description:
Description

Game-AI-Final: The final that got me really into AI. I used Unreal Engine’s behaviors tree to create enemies that scout the player and alert others to go on the attack. They chase they player and can jump from ledge to ledge to chase them.

item.title: Jurassic Pack
item.description:
Description

One of my largest games and one I take a lot of pride in. This was the largest team I have ever worked with and we created an Auto-Battler Card opening game with Dinosaurs. As lead programmer I did a lot of the mechanics and enemy AI to create the strategic depth of the game as well as create the “auto” part in Auto-Battler.

item.title: Lurking Below
item.description:
Description

My first networking game with a larger team. A three player Chase ’em that involves a diver fixing machines underwater, an engineer in the submarine to guide the diver, and the creature who tries to hunt the diver. I spent a lot of time learning how Networking works in Unreal and made a functioning lobby system that can assign roles to each player as well as create all the tasks the Engineer does in the submarine.

item.title: Note Evasion
item.description:
Description

The First game I ever made with a team. A simple rhythm game where you dodge incoming notes to the beat of the song. As the lone programmer I did all the gameplay mechanics as well as make tools for designers to use and shape the game.
